page.title: 03Forest Walks
page.content: During the period from 1975 to 1985 the Forestry Commission have been increasing the opportunities for recreation in Exeter Forest.This has included the laying out ofsignposted forest trails,provision of information boards,and the construction of car parks.Viewpoints have also been created,sometimes by felling of sections of plantations,and picnic sites have been set up.Forest trails are signposted off the main roads.The walks are popular with local visitors and are becoming increasingly used by the non resident tourists.They also provide a counter-attraction to the Dartmoor National Park.Walks are designed to be of varying length and difficulty,and take visitors deep into the forest.Information sheets are also available.
